clues.text: Anne McCaffrey, author of the "Pern" novels, is a well-known writer in this genre
"Malice", published in 1996, is her 37th bestseller
This author of "Heartburn" has written several films, including "When Harry Met Sally"
This African-American author set her first novel, "The Bluest Eye", in Lorain, Ohio, her birthplace
This creator of V.I. Warshawski co-founded Sisters in Crime, an organization for women mystery writers
This director played the title role in the 1953 cross-dressing classic "Glen or Glenda?"
"She's Gotta Have It", his first feature, had a budget of $175,000
With "The Seventh Seal" he established the religious themes that characterize much of his work
This man won his first of 3 Best Director Oscars for the film seen here:
This director of "Forrest Gump" also directed all 3 "Back to the Future" features
Canadian architect Carlos Ott designed the Opera Bastille, which opened in this city in 1989
Verdi was paid 150,000 francs to compose this opera for the khedive of Egypt
"Das Liebesverbot", this German's only foray into Italian-style opera, was a total failure
Beethoven wrote 16 versions of the hero's entrance in this opera & we still don't know if he's satisfied
This capital city's Court Opera was renamed Staatsoper in 1918
During the Caroline Affair in 1837, a group of Canadians sank a U.S. steamer above these falls
Joan of Arc rose to fame during this long series of wars
Around 500 Clovis had the "Gaul" to unite these peoples; Pepin became "King of " them in 751
This Spanish princess was married to Henry VIII's brother before she married Henry
Justinian built this Turkish church 532-537 intending to make it the most splendid in the world
In the original film it's the night in 1963 when 6-year-old Michael Myers stabbed his sister to death
"Roanoke", about a haunted farm house in North Carolina, is the sixth season of this FX anthology
Both a 1999 film & its 2016 sequel feature found footage exploring this title figure in the Maryland woods
"What's Wrong With Norman" was an episode of this drama on A&E
Ghostface, the white-masked killer in this 1996 film, asks, "What's your favorite scary movie?
Thermal underwear
When it's Girl Scout cookie time, stock up on Trefoils, this type of cookie
MLB's Carlos Correa & Corey Seager
Stephen King's "The Glass Floor" or "Graveyard Shift"
This phrase meaning "old" alludes to a horse's gums receding as it ages
Bear is an enthusiastic type of this greeting
In 2014 Maori leaders in this nation greeted the Duchess of Cambridge with the traditional hongi, touching noses
If you're eager to receive a guest you proverbially "put out" this item with a 7-letter word on it
British restraint doesn't get much more restrained than this 4-word greeting used in Africa in 1871
Spoken greetings in more than 50 languages were sent along on this craft & its twin launched in 1977
AKA Provitamin A, it gives a bright orange color to vegetables
These drugs that suppress reactions in heart cells are prescribed to treat anxiety & angina
It's the second-brightest star in a constellation named for a man-horse hybrid
It was founded at the College of William & Mary in 1776; are you a member?
Electron emission & positron emission are types of this radioactive disintegration
The standard blues musical form is one of this many bars
Legend has it, having forgotten about a 1924 deadline, George Gershwin wrote this piece in 3 weeks
Before going solo, Teddy Pendergrass was the lead singer of Harold Melvin & this group
He retitled his 1909 song "Mr. Crump" "Memphis Blues" & the rest is history
The 1970 hit song "Roadhouse Blues" by this band warns "Keep your eyes on the road, your hands upon the wheel"
With over 250 billion barrels of crude reserves, this Mideast nation is the world's No. 1 oil exporter
In oil exploration geologists look for these compounds that consist only of the 2 elements symbolized by H & C
The jackknife type of this tower over an oil well comes in 2 sections that are assembled on site
The site of a major oil leak in 1979, the Bay of Campeche is the southernmost part of this body of water
Last name of Erle, who started an oil well services firm in 1919 that spread worldwide, including Iraq
In 2016, 40 years after she became a "Today" show regular, she became the new host of CBS' "Sunday Morning"
In 1889 journalist Nellie Bly tried to beat the record of Phileas Fogg in this novel & did, by more than a week
This historian wrote the memoir "Wait Till Next Year" about her childhood as Brooklyn Dodgers fan Doris Kearns
After the Battle of Cedar Mountain in 1862, a surgeon wrote, "If heaven ever sent out a(n)...angel," she "must be one"
This New York-born Supreme Court justice was the first female U.S. Solicitor General
Gold & blue are this Bluegrass State's official colors
The front of Texas' state seal has a lone one of these in its center
In Oregon it's the Oregon grape; in Wyoming, it's the Indian paintbrush
Oklahoma's state song was written by this duo
In Arizona it's the paloverde; in Hawaii, it's the kukui

rounds.text: The area in which this 1961 musical was filmed was soon razed to make way for the new Lincoln Center
